item.title: Overwatch 2: Best Juno Stadium Builds
item.description:
Overwatch Stadium has been a popular addition to the OW2 game since its release in Season 16. The game mode has two teams of five players lock in a hero of their choice for the match, and then play to earn currency over a set of shorter mini rounds. At the end of each round, they can then use this currency it purchase new Powers and Items, creating a build for their hero that consists of new bonus effects/abilities, additional buffs and passives, and more.

There are three different categories to choose your items from - Weapon, Ability, and Survivability, yet there are limited slots for your chosen items. For this reason, knowing Powers that synergize well and which items you can take at each stage of the game to enhance them is important. If you're looking to play Juno in the Support role, the best Overwatch Stadium builds for her have been outlined in the guide below.

Overwatch Stadium: Best Juno Builds, Explained

In Overwatch Stadium, Juno has been quite a popular pick due to the sheer power a solid build for her holds. The most popular general build for her revolves around fully buffing out her Torpedoes causing her to deal huge damage and huge healing simultaneously, all whilst reducing her cooldown charges as much as possible. The second Juno build revolves around her Glide Boosters, and buffing cooldown on them to ensure she pretty much always has them, granting Juno great movement to assist her team.

Overwatch Stadium: Torpedo Juno Build

Torpedo Juno Build - Powers

Round 1: Pulsaur Plus - Pulsar Torpedoes gain 1 additional charge.

Round 3: Cosmic Coolant - Pulsar Torpedoes cooldown is reduced by 0.5s for each target it hits.

Round 5: Medicinal Missiles - Pulsar Torpedoes heal for an extra 30 HP and causes allies hit to recieve 50% more healing for 3s.

Round 7: Stinger - Mediblaster deals an additional 10 damage to enemies over 1s. (Does not stack)

This Juno build revolves around putting essentially almost everything into her Torpedoes, and heavily focusing on Ability damage increase, as this is what the Torpedoes are tied to. You'll also want to keep an eye out for Items specialized for Juno that will come in handy, such as the explosive damage on Torpedo hits. By the mid-late game, this build should be able to take a squishy target down to at least half health with a Torpedo hit, with the potential to even one-shot some heroes.

For the purpose of helping you find these items in game, each one has been marked with an indicator. (WPN) - Weapon Category, (ABL) - Ability, (SURV) - Survival. Some Items have been mentioned in multiple stages, as depending on your preferences, the amount of currency you have available, or what is ongoing in the match, you may choose to make big impulsive buys early to create a steep improvement in the early-mid game, or take a more steady improvement approach for mid-late game.

Torpedo Juno - Early Game Items (Round 1-2)

  • (WPN) Compensator - +5% weapon power.
  • (ABL) Power Playbook - +10 ability power.
  • (SURV) Armored Vest - +25 armor.
  • (ABL) PulStar Destroyers - +10% ability Lifesteal, Pulsar Torpedoes explode on a hit and deal 20 damage to nearby enemies. ( note: This is an all-in round 2 purchase - depending on your preference or the match progression, it may be safer to buy this item in the Mid Game instead, and instead opt for some of the Rare item options below)
  • (ABL) Nano Cola - +20% ability power.
  • (ABL) Multi-tool - +5% ability power, +10% cooldown reduction.

Torpedo Juno - Mid Game Items (Round 3-5)

  • (ABL) Nano Cola - +20% ability power.
  • (ABL) Multi-tool - +5% ability power, +10% cooldown reduction.
  • (ABL) PulStar Destroyers - +10% ability Lifesteal, Pulsar Torpedoes explode on a hit and deal 20 damage to nearby enemies.
  • (SURV) Vital-e-tee - +10 armor, covert 100 HP into armor.
  • (ABL) Champion's Kit - +40% ability power.
  • (ABL) Three-Tap Tommygun - +10% ability power, +10% attack speed, after using an ability your next 3 instances fo weapon damage deal additional damage equal to 3% of the target's life.
  • (ABL) Wrist Wraps - +5% ability power, +10% attack speed.
  • (WPN) - Pulse Spike - +10 attack speed, +35% Pular Torpedoes projectile speed, after using Pulsar Torpedoes gain 25% attack speed for 4s.

Torpedo Juno - Late Game Items (Round 6-7)

  • (WPN) - Pulse Spike - +10 attack speed, +35% Pular Torpedoes projectile speed, after using Pulsar Torpedoes gain 25% attack speed for 4s.
  • (ABL) Champion's Kit - +40% ability power
  • (ABL) Three-Tap Tommygun - +10% ability power, +10% attack speed, after using an ability your next 3 instances fo weapon damage deal additional damage equal to 3% of the target's life.
  • (ABL) Wrist Wraps - +5% ability power, +10% attack speed.
  • (ABL) Lock-on Shield - +10% ability power, while aiming Pulsar Torpedoes gain Overhealth equal to 50% of your max shields.
  • (ABL) Liquid Nitrogen - +25 HP, +10% ability power, dealing ability damage slows the target's move speed for by 20% for 3s.
  • (ABL) Catalytic Crystal - +15% ability power, ability damage and healing grants +20% Ult. charge.

Overwatch Stadium: Infinite Glide Juno Build

Infinite Glide Juno Build - Powers

Round 1: Stinger - Mediblaster deals an additional 10 damage to enemies over 1s. (Does not stack)

Round 3: Blink Boosts - Glide Boost gains 2 additional charges and has a 65% reduced cooldown, but has 75% reduced duration.

Round 5: Hyper Healer - Allies affecgted by Hyper Ring gain 50 Overhealth.

Round 7: Rally Ring - Reduce Hyper-Ring's cooldown by 1s when an ally passes through it.

This build focuses specifically on buffing Juno's mobility and movement by giving her additional Glide charges with a reduced cooldown, and significaly raising her attack speed. This ties in nicely with the reduced Hyper-Ring cooldowns to help not only her own mobility but also to assist her teammates in getting in and out of fights and repositioning on a more frequent basis. Essentially, you'll pretty much always have a speed boost through your Glide, and you can rapidly speed boost your allies which is a huge asset.

Infinite Glide Juno - Early Game Items (Round 1-2)

  • (WPN) Weapon Grease - +5% attack speed
  • (WPN) Compensator - +5% weapon power.
  • (SURV) Armored Vest - +25 armor.
  • (WPN) Harlight Accelerator -+10% weapon power, +10% cooldown reduction, when you use an ability gain 5% weapon power for 3s - stacking up to 3 times. ( note: This is an all-in round 2 purchase - depending on your preference or the match progression, it may be safer to buy this item in the Mid Game instead, and instead opt for some of the Rare item options below)
  • (SURV) Boosted Rockets - +25 shields, +25% Glide Boost duration.
  • (WPN) Icy Coolant - +10% weapon power, +5% cooldown reduction.

Infinite Glide Juno - Mid Game Items (Round 3-5)

  • (WPN) Harlight Accelerator -+10% weapon power, +10% cooldown reduction, when you use an ability gain 5% weapon power for 3s - stacking up to 3 times.
  • (SURV) Boosted Rockets - +25 shields, +25% Glide Boost duration.
  • (WPN) Vantage Shot - +5% weapon power, while airbone, mediblaster deals 15% more damage.
  • (WPN) Icy Coolant - +10% weapon power, +5% cooldown reduction.
  • (WPN) Gravitational Push - +15% weapon power, during Glide Boost gain 20% attack speed and your quick melee knocks people back.
  • (WPN) Booster Jets - +20% attack speed, when you use an ability gain +20% move speed for 3s.
  • (WPN) Aftermarket Firing Pin - +10% attack speed, +5% move speed.
  • (ABL) Lux Loop - +10% ability power, +25% Hyper Ring duration.

Infinite Glide Juno - Late Game Items (Round 6-7)

  • (WPN) Gravitational Push - +15% weapon power, during Glide Boost gain 20% attack speed and your quick melee knocks people back.
  • (WPN) Booster Jets - +20% attack speed, when you use an ability gain +20% move speed for 3s.
  • (WPN) Harlight Accelerator -+10% weapon power, +10% cooldown reduction, when you use an ability gain 5% weapon power for 3s - stacking up to 3 times.
  • (SURV) Phantasmic Flux - 10% weapon power, 10% ability power, 15% weapon lifesteal, 15% ability lifesteal, while at full HP, lifesteal grants up to 100 Overhealth.
  • (WPN) Weapon Jammer - +25 armor, +10% weapon power, dealing weapon damage negates 10% of the target's bonus attack speed and increases your attack speed by 10% for 2s.

item.title: Overwatch 2: Best Reaper Stadium Builds
item.description:
Overwatch 2's Stadium mode, introduced in Season 16, brings a fast-paced new gameplay mode to the table. With limited hero options and no mid-game counter-picks, players will earn currency each round and spend it between to build their hero through pairing Powers with Items from the Weapon, Ability, and Survivability categories.

Each category offers powerful upgrades that can transform how your chosen hero plays as the match progresses. From ability add-ons, new abilities, passives, buffs to speed, damage output, and more, there are plenty of different options when it comes to creating a build for Reaper. If you're looking to set foot in Stadium as Overwatch's iconic edgelord DPS, some of the best possible build combinations have been outlined in the guide below.

Overwatch Stadium: Best Reaper Builds, Explained

In Overwatch Stadium, Reaper builds tend to focus on the likes of buffing damage, putting everything into lifesteal, improving the impact of Death Blossom, or increasing his survivability and self-sustain. With a combination of these abilities and powers, two key builds have been identified as solid starting places for getting the hang of Reaper in Stadium. The first of these builds focuses on Reaper being a backline damage machine with unique survivability buffs and high damage. The other build focuses on his Death Blossom and farming Ult. Charge, enabling you to make big players and wipe multiple enemies to turn a team fight and therefore win these shorter mini-rounds.

Overwatch Stadium: Backline Damage Reaper Build

Backline Damage Reaper Build - Powers

Round 1: Wraith Renewal - While in Wraith Form, restore 10% of your HP every 1s. Double this while below 50% HP.

Round 3: Spirited to Slay - Eliminations reset your cooldowns.

Round 5: Revolving Ruin - Close-range (7m) Hellfire Shotgun hits grant 5% Attack Speed for 1s, stacking up to 8 times.

Round 7: Strangle Step - After using Shadow Step, double your Lifesteal for 3s.

This build focuses on taking key powers rather than enhancing Reaper's power in the backline. The self-heal on Wraith works perfectly with the Item that enables you to fly whilst in Wraith, granting you great mobility on a self-heal and therefore very strong self-sustain in the backline. Eliminations resetting your cooldowns are pretty self-explanatory - with you pretty much having your self-heal wraith and shadow step back every time to help you continue to clean up the enemy team.

Lastly, you attack speed stacking at close range and Lifesteal off a Shadow Step pretty much enables you to be able to step into the enemy backline, shoot until you kill (or self-heal wraith to keep yourself alive until you can get a kill), rinse, and repeat.

Backline Damage Reaper Build - Early Game Items (Round 1-2)

  • (WPN) Weapon Grease - +5% attack speed
  • (WPN) Compensator - +5% weapon power.
  • (SURV) Heartbeat Sensor - +5% movement speed, enemies below 30% health are revealed to you
  • (WPN) Frenzy Amplifier - Eliminations grant +10% attack speed and move speed for 3s.
  • (SURV) Wretched Wings -+25 HP, while in Wraith form gain the ability to fly and gain 20% move speed. ( note: This is an all-in round 2 purchase - depending on your preference or the match progression, it may be safer to buy this item in the Mid Game instead, and instead opt for some of the Rare item options below)
  • (WPN) Stockpile - +5% attack speed, +25% max ammo.
  • (WPN) Icy Coolant - +10% weapon power, +5% cooldown reduction.
  • (WPN) Aftermarket Firing Pin - +10% attack speed, +5% move speed.

Backline Damage Reaper Build - Early Game Items (Round 3-5)

  • (SURV) Wretched Wings -+25 HP, while in Wraith form gain the ability to fly and gain 20% move speed.
  • (SURV) Dauntless Draught - +50 HP, +15% move speed during Wraith, +33% Wraith duration.
  • (WPN) Stockpile - +5% attack speed, +25% max ammo.
  • (WPN) Icy Coolant - +10% weapon power, +5% cooldown reduction.
  • (WPN) Aftermarket Firing Pin - +10% attack speed, +5% move speed.
  • (WPN) Harlight Accelerator -+10% weapon power, +10% cooldown reduction, when you use an ability gain 5% weapon power for 3s - stacking up to 3 times.
  • (WPN) The Closer - +20% weapon power, +10% critical damage, critical hits reveal the target for 3s.

Backline Damage Reaper Build - Early Game Items (Round 6-7)

  • (WPN) Harlight Accelerator -+10% weapon power, +10% cooldown reduction, when you use an ability gain 5% weapon power for 3s - stacking up to 3 times.
  • (WPN) The Closer - +20% weapon power, +10% critical damage, critical hits reveal the target for 3s.
  • (SURV) Pocket Mist - +25 HP, while below 50% HP gain 20% move speed.
  • (WPN) Salvaged Slugs - +10% attack speed, +30% damage to barriers, dealing weapon damage to barriers has a 50% chance to restore 1 ammo.
  • (WPN) Eye of the Spider - +25% weapon power, deal +10% increased damage to enemies below 30% HP.

Overwatch Stadium: Death Blossom Reaper Build

Death Blossom Reaper Build - Powers

Round 1: Death Step - After using Shadow Step, cast Death Blossom for 1.5s with 50% reduced damage.

Round 3: Wraith Renewal - While in Wraith Form, restore 10% of your HP every 1s. Double this when below 50% HP.

Round 5: Shrouded Shrapnel - Using Wrath Form increases the number of pellets per shot in your next magazine by 25% and its spread by 50%.

Round 5: Revolving Ruin - Close-range (7m) Hellfire Shotgun hits grant 5% Attack Speed for 1s, stacking up to 8 times.

This Reaper build focuses on empowering Reaper's Death Blossom by giving it to him on his Shadow Step ability, and then drastically pumping both weapon speed and ability damage to make even your mini-Blossoms hit hard and farm easy Ult. charge. You can then use other Items to add more survivability to Reaper on top of his Wraith heal, through the likes of lifesteal and cooldown reduction.

This also means you can cast your Shadow Step/mini-Blossom into the enemy team more frequently, deal a bunch of close-ranged damage through your improved attack speed, Wraith away to self-heal (pair with the Wraith fly item for even more utility), proccing Shrouded Shrapnel for you to then circle back around and initiate your next lot of damage. Then, rinse and repeat!

Death Blossom Reaper Build - Early Game Items (Round 1-2)

  • (WPN) Weapon Grease - +5% attack speed
  • (ABL) Power Playbook - +10 ability power
  • (WPN) Compensator - +5% weapon power.
  • (SURV) Heartbeat Sensor - +5% movement speed, enemies below 30% health are revealed to you.
  • (SURV) Wretched Wings -+25 HP, while in Wraith form gain the ability to fly and gain 20% move speed. ( note: This is an all-in round 2 purchase - depending on your preference or the match progression, it may be safer to buy this item in the Mid Game instead, and instead opt for some of the Rare item options below)
  • (ABL) Nano Cola - +20% ability power.
  • (ABL) Energized Bracers - +10% ability power, +10% ability lifesteal.
  • (ABL) Wrist Wraps - +5% ability power, +10% attack speed.

Death Blossom Reaper Build - Early Game Items (Round 3-5)

  • (SURV) Wretched Wings -+25 HP, while in Wraith form, gain the ability to fly and gain 20% move speed.
  • (ABL) Nano Cola - +20% ability power.
  • (ABL) Energized Bracers - +10% ability power, +10% ability lifesteal.
  • (Surv) Phantasmic Flux - +10% weapon power, +10% ability lifesteal, +15% weapon lifesteal, +15% ability lifesteal, while at full HP lifesteal grants up to 100 HP.
  • (ABL) Wrist Wraps - +5% ability power, +10% attack speed.
  • (ABL) Wreath of Ruin - +20% ability power, +25% Death Blossom radius, +20% move speed whilst in Death Blossom.

Death Blossom Reaper Build- Early Game Items (Round 6-7)

  • (ABL) Wrist Wraps - +5% ability power, +10% attack speed.
  • (ABL) Wreath of Ruin - +20% ability power, +25% Death Blossom radius, +20% move speed whilst in Death Blossom.
  • (SURV) Devastation - +15% ability lifesteal, each Death Blossom elimination increases your HP by 25 until the end of the round. (max +100 HP)
  • (ABL) Champion's Kit - +40% ability power.
  • (ABL) Iridiscent Iris - +20% ability power, +10% cooldown reduction, after spending your Ult. Charge gain 100 Overhealth for 3s.
  • (ABL)Nightcreeper - +10% movement speed, +30% Shadow Step cast speed, using Wraith reduces the cooldown of Shadow Step for 2s.

item.title: Roblox: Project Egoist Codes (May 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Project Egoist Codes
  • How to Redeem Project Egoist Codes
  • How to Get More Project Egoist Codes

Project Egoist is one of the representatives of football simulators based on the Blue Lock manga and anime series. Therefore, each match on the field is more like a battle than a game. During it, you have to use all possible tricks and unique skills to win. And to get a powerful moveset from the first minute of the game, you must use Project Egoist codes.

Codes grant players various goodies from the developers, among which you will find both unique Titles and Yen. The latter is the main currency in this Roblox game, for which you can roll new styles.

All Project Egoist Codes

Working Project Egoist Codes

  • ThanksFor5kFollowEvent - Redeem this code to get 2.5k Yen
  • ThanksFor10kFollowEvent - Redeem this code to get 2.5k Yen
  • ProjectEgoist - Redeem this code to get 4k Yen
  • ProjectEgoistRelease - Redeem this code to get a Rare Fan Title

Expired Project Egoist Codes

There are no expired codes in Project Egoist . We will update this article as soon as more codes become available.

Project Egoist offers you very dynamic gameplay. The main task of each player is to score goals, as in the original anime. To do this, you can use various tricks and unique skills of your current style. By default, players own the Isagi style, which is good for learning the basics, but not very competitive compared to other styles. For this reason, you will need to save up Yen for scoring goals to roll new Styles. And Project Egoist codes will help you with this.

Most of these codes will reward you with the money you need to get new abilities. Some of them will even give you up to 4k Yen, so you can equip better styles before you start your first match.

How to Redeem Project Egoist Codes

The code redemption feature in Project Egoist works extremely simply. If you are familiar with other Roblox experiences, you will figure it out without any problems. It's also worth noting that not all players can redeem codes in Project Egoist . Only those who have joined the developers' Roblox group have access to this option. If you are already a member of a group, then simply follow these steps:

  • Launch Project Egoist .
  • Then, click on the button with the ticket icon on the left side of the screen.
  • After that, enter the code in the field. We recommend you copy and paste the codes instead of manually entering them. This will help you avoid misspellings, as Roblox is case-sensitive.
  • Finally, click on the Redeem button to claim the reward.

How to Get More Project Egoist Codes

To get the latest Project Egoist codes, you should bookmark this guide. We plan to update it over time, as well as our other Roblox code articles. In addition, players can visit the official social media pages of the developers. There you will find all the news about events, updates, and fresh codes first-hand:

  • Official ErzT7 YouTube channel
  • Official Project Egoist Discord server
  • Official Cool group for big cool people Roblox group

item.title: Destiny 2 Player Turns Their Hunter Into the Mandalorian
item.description:
Summary

  • An inventive player recreated the Mandalorian in Destiny 2 using specific armor pieces and shaders.
  • Players show love for Star Wars by creating armor sets inspired by iconic characters like the Mandalorian.
  • Destiny 2's official Star Wars collaboration includes armor sets for Hunters, Warlocks, and Titans inspired by Star Wars characters.

A Destiny 2 player has shared a build that recreates the Mandalorian from Star Wars . Destiny 2 and Star Wars are IPs known for telling stories set in universes with unique characters and eye-catching outfits. So it's no surprise that players of Bungie's shooter often show affection for the Disney franchise by creating armor sets inspired by its characters.

Previously, an inventive Destiny 2 turned their Titan into C3PO, the yellow droid from the Star Wars films who forms the charismatic duo with his friend R2-D2, resulting in an armor set with many details in common. A second player recreated Captain Enoch from the Star Wars: Ahsoka series, designing a set of armor highly similar to that used by the Night Troopers. This time, another community member shared a build inspired by the Star Wars universe, recreating one of its most beloved characters.

In a new post on the DestinyFashion subreddit, a user named fsdogdad showed how they transformed their Hunter into the Mandalorian from the popular Disney+ series. To make the build, they used the Solstice Mask (Majestic), an ornament that stands out most for impressively reproducing the helmet worn by Pedro Pascal's character. The rest of the armor is made up of the Righteous Grips, Wall-watcher Vest, Lucky Pants, and Covert Ranger Cloak, which recreates the cloak worn by the Mandalorian on his adventures across the galaxy.

Inventive Destiny 2 Build Transforms Hunter Into Star Wars Mandalorian

A key part of Destiny 2 builds are the shaders, which help to give extra life to the armor created by players. To bring the Mandalorian to life, the OP used Iron Wolf, Cayde's Duds, Warbrick, and Darkwater Froth, Legendary shaders introduced in Seasons 1, 4, 6, and 10. They also used the Dead Man's Tale scout rifle to reproduce the Amban sniper rifle, one of the weapons used by the Mandalorian, since the two have a significantly similar design. To give the build an extra touch, they painted the Hunter's Ghost Shell green, an allusion to the little Grogu that accompanies the Mandalorian and is eventually adopted by him.

While players have already created armor sets paying homage to Star Wars several times, Bungie also has an official collaboration with the franchise. The Destiny 2 x Star Wars crossover was released earlier this year, adding three armor sets. With these, Hunters can be dressed as Death Troopers, Warlocks as members of the Imperial Royal Guard, and Warlocks as the iconic Stormtroopers.

item.title: V Rising: Elixir Guide
item.description:
V Rising is the perfect blend of horror and survival as players roam the dark forests as a vampire. They rise to the top fighting against bosses, the environment, and each other. The combat is a mixture of spells and melee, and the stronger players get, as do their foes.

The 1.1 Invaders of Oakveil update introduced a lot of new content, including bosses, blood types, fighting systems, and consumables. Consumables consist of potions, weapon boosters, and Elixirs that assist players as they struggle for power. Elixirs are powerful consumables with many effects, so we've compiled a complete guide to Elixirs in V Rising , including how to get them, all their effects, and tips for using them.

What are Elixirs in V Rising

Elixirs are potions that players drink to boost their vampire builds temporarily. All Elixirs are associated with a secondary stat and last for sixty minutes. Elixirs can boost speed, maximum health, spell power, and more.

Only one Elixir can be active at a time.

There are eight Elixirs based on the V Blood Carrier who holds the recipe in V Rising . Elixirs persist even through death, so players won't lose their effects if they run into trouble or are caught out in the sun.

How to Get Elixirs in V Rising

Elixirs are consumables, so players need the Alchemy Table to brew them. The Alchemy Table blueprint is unlocked when Clive the Firestarter, a level 30 V Blood Carrier, is defeated. V Blood Carriers can be found by tracking their scent, and once players locate and beat them, they earn rewards. Clive's rewards include:

  • Tier 1 Spell Point
  • Alchemy Table
  • Minor Explosive Box

Players will also need to unlock Elixir recipes. Elixir recipes are unlocked by defeating V Blood Carriers. Their ingredients include common resources throughout the land, like Blood Roses and Hell's Clarion .

All Elixirs and Their Effects in V Rising

Elixir

Effect

V Blood Carrier

Ingredients

Elixir of the Crow

  • Weapon Leech is increased by 5%
  • Weapon Cooldown Rate increased by 7% for sixty minutes.

  • Jade the Vampire Hunter
  • Level 57

  • Mourning Lily (20)
  • Bleeding Heart (20)
  • Greater Blood Essence (1)
  • Empty Glass Bottle (1)

Elixir of the Bat

  • Spell Leech is increased by 5%
  • Spell Cooldown Rate increased by 7%

  • General Cassius the Betrayer
  • Level 57

  • Blood Rose (20)
  • Bleeding Heart (20)
  • Greater Blood Essence (1)
  • Empty Glass Bottle (1)

Elixir of the Werewolf

  • Attack Speed increased by 7%
  • Weapon Skill Power increased by 8%

  • Willfred the Village Elder
  • Level 64

  • Ghost Shroom (20)
  • Fire Blossom (20)
  • Greater Blood Essence (1)
  • Empty Glass Bottle (1)

Elixir of the Beast

  • Maximum Health increased by 8%
  • Healing Received increased by 12%
